title: Do you prefer these boards or traditional style forums?
body:
Boards being what this is, reddit-style format and all that
Forums being like this http://forums.oce.leagueoflegends.com/board/forumdisplay.php?f=59

replies.body: I don't understand why the boards were put on OCE. The forums held a community for a long time, General discussion was something exciting, the members were characters and honestly, my fondest memories to do with LoL involved the community which grew in the forums. Specific members were known for things, some held events, some showed awesome creations, which overall showed how much people liked this game. When the forums went down for good and the community I loved vanished my interest and passion for this game quickly became non-existent. Bringing back forums might return a sense of liveliness back into this pitiful server.

Forums without question. When boards was released I originally saw a lot of people QQing about the colour scheme, while I don't like it by any means I don't find it insufferable... The issue with boards for me is readability issues, big ones. 

I like the idea that we can swap to a more forum-esque layout but the issue is it simply doesn't work. You can't see who's replying to who or anything, and I think the reddit layout is flawed from the beginning, it heavily promotes circlejerking popular opinions rather than actual discussion - anyone with an unpopular opinion is downvoted and their opinion is just hidden and ignored. On reddit if your posts are downvoted a bit more than upvoted you can be automatically shadowbanned - you can still post threads but noone will be able to see them, which, as I shouldn't have to say, is fucking disgusting.

The lack of being able to bump old threads also hurts badly, I get that you want new content but sometimes it's far, far better to be able to bring up old threads rather than making new ones - remember all those streamer threads on old GD? Would you rather one, bumped when a streamer starts streaming, or 30 of the same thing?

Even though I'm a pessimist, I'm still posting this. Why, you ask? Because I miss what old GD was, and I don't think boards works for actual discussion purposes like I said earlier, it's just circlejerk bullshit. I miss the shitposters, the 300 page threads of meaningless chatting, things like player pics (even though I never posted a real pic lol), forum game threads, stories, and the community as a whole. Boards killed us, the soul of GD lives on but the only way it's coming back is if its body is restored, I think.
Very true. Good conversations disappear in a wash of nonsense.  Bumping was very handy.

I prefer the old system. All it takes is for a few down votes from trolls and a post gets buried for everyone. Sure this board system stops thread necromancy but unless someone is looking for something they will likely not find anything beyond a page or two, whereas bumping your own stuff or things you found interesting could help keep topics or just conversations alive. I rarely search for things anymore either. 

I feel that the board type fragmented the ability for conversations that forums had. Now I'm lucky to be bothered with interesting questions/content from other people because the crap stays at the surface. Also, every time I see the word boards I think "You have to be pretty _bored _ to go to the boards."

Sure I can use the champion icons to write short dialogues with them saying something funny but it is just not the same. Bumping them was the only way to let people know I hadn't finished if it disappeared too quick or just to give it some more exposure but hey even adding more won't even bring it back to the top now. If people give a shit they will have to search for it but can anyone be bothered now? A post might have one or two responses but too bad if you want more and no one goes looking for your thread.

I know I'm just going around in circles here but that is it really, the problems just keep remaking themselves. At least the forums had a flow to them, a shift. It actually felt alive. When no one was posting a dead forum felt dead but it was only temporary, people would come and go. Instead of the tide like forum structure we're all just sitting in a muddy puddle here.

Forums all the way Baby. 
I use to check GD every day when it was up and running. This is the first time I've had an incentive to visit the boards in over 6 months.
Amen soul sister.

Forums. 

Boards, while worth a shot, did not achieve the outcome it sought and has only damaged the communities we had.

Forums for sure. 

When a community is small enough for a chronological view to keep most posts on the front page for half a day, it's pretty sustainable. It does seem like quite a few new posts sink into the void on boards.

Definitely forums. 
They were much easier to use. The forum felt more like a community because frequent posters grew into well-known characters and personalities that people enjoyed reading and discussing League related topics with. It was a also a place I would frequently post ideas and get feed-back from. This board isn't even half as popular, and the formatting makes it annoying to deal with.
